intro: Psychotria wichmannii, commonly known as the "ghost plant," is a member of the Rubiaceae family, native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It is a small, evergreen shrub characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces tiny, fleshy berries that are often consumed by various bird species. Psychotria wichmannii is notable for its ability to thrive in shaded, humid environments and its role in supporting local biodiversity. Its botanical features make it an important component of tropical ecosystems.
